value.0:
The Holy Orders of Benwick.

The Holy Orders of Benwick are three religious orders of knights, dedicated 
to the three vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience.

Poverty - They may only own their weapons and equipment.  The rest of their 
fortune they give to the poor.  However, they are obligated to equip 
themselves with Plate mail as soon as they may, as well as the weapons of 
their order.

Chastity - They may not marry nor engage in any trysts of any sort, they 
have offered up their sexuality as a sacrifice to their deity.  Such 
violations are often grounds for dismissal from the order.

Obedience - They are completely obedient to their superiors surrendering all 
pretense of power and glory for the good of the whole.

Each order has it's own purpose however, so while they all vow to poverty, 
chastity, and obedience, they have different markings and likewise, 
different duties.

The Knights of St. Jerome - The Crusading order, the Knights of St. Jasper 
are first and foremost the warrior order.  They are the front of the line, 
the point of the wedge, and the head of the column in the fight against 
evil.  Dedicated to one of three fighting styles, the formal (Fighter), the 
unarmed (Monk), or the berzerker (Barbarian) they nevertheless can have 
Priests who are familiar with one of the three fighting styles 
(Multi-classed with Fighter, Barbarian, or Monk) among their membership.

It is the Knights of St. Jerome who are the primary order waging the Holy 
War against the evil drow and their Goddess Lolth.  But like all of the Holy 
Orders of Benwick, they are fighting first and foremost for souls.  For 
them, a good Drow joining their ranks is as great a victory as the 
destruction of an entire Drow city.  Their symbol is an upright gold sword 
upon a white field.  As their 'church' is the battle field, they are the 
one order found most often out adventuring in Amia.  They are most often 
armed with a spear or other pole arm and crossbow.

Their motto is  Timesne Me? Debes. (Latin for "Do you fear me?  You 
should!")

The Knights of St. Mark - The Protecting Order, the Knights of St. Mark are 
Benwick's guardians.  Charged with the protection of temples and pilgrims 
upon pilgrimage, they are the chief Chivalric (Paladin) order of the Holy 
Orders but likewise, they may also be familiar with the three fighting 
styles (multi-classed with Fighters, Barbarians, or Monks).

For them, their cathedral is the road or the shrine.  While they can be out 
training on the field, their primary focus is taking less experienced 
members with them in order to educate them.  (In other words, they always 
are the highest level member of a party if they can be.)   Likewise, they 
are the most familiar with Benwick's and the lands surrounding the kingdom 
geography.  Their symbol is an upright white sword upon a black background.  
They are most often armed with a sword and shield unless the sword is two 
handed.  They seldom carry missile weapons.

Note: there are rumors that some of them are familiar with the arcane arts 
as well, but this would be most inappropriate for their order's make up.

The Knights of St. Jasper - The Healing Order, the Knights of St. Jasper are 
Benwick's healers.  Found almost always in hostels, shrines, or 
Cathedrals, they are the most Priestly (Cleric) of the three orders of 
Knights, but may also be familiar with one of the three fighting styles 
(Multi-class with Fighter, Barbarian, or Monk).

Their primary field of service is in shelters and hospitals, but if they do 
go out, it's chiefly for the healing that they can employ to succor the 
group, thus they fight only as a last resort.

Their symbol is a red sword upright upon a white background.  Their domains 
are chiefly Healing and War, but other domains may be added with healing.  
Likewise, they fight with mace or other bludgeoning weapon - since they are 
prohibited from shedding blood - and sling and shield.
